segments.text: Everything in this kitchen seems to radiate normalcy, yet there’s a tension lurking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman looks so calm, her expression focused on the task at hand.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I notice the water pooling around her feet, a messy warning she’s completely oblivious to.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of frustration watching the boy precariously balancing on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How reckless can he be, climbing up as if it was the most natural thing in the world?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl at his side raises her arm, her bright eyes fixed on the cookie jar, oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re both so innocent, yet they’re in an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost hear the thud of that stool tipping and the laughter turning into cries.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, the opening in the garden is so inviting, offering a glimpse of tranquility.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish they would take a moment to appreciate the world outside rather than chase after cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR
